text: Preheat your oven to 180ºC/350ºF.  Remove the core from the apples, but leave the stem intact at the top.  Mix the chopped nuts and 2/3 cup of the brown sugar together in a small bowl. Using a teaspoon, stuff each of the apple cores with this mixture. Place the apples upright on a baking dish. If you need to, you can lean them against each other so they don't fall over. Combine the remaining sugar, apple juice or cider, butter or margarine and spices in a large saucepan. Bring the mixture to a simmer and stir it with a wooden spoon until the butter is melted. Once the syrup is hot, pour it into the baking dish around the apples. Put the baking dish in the oven and bake the apples for 30 minutes.  Remove the apples and allow them to cool for 10 minutes. Place each apple into a serving bowl. Make a small incision at the top of each apple and insert a gummy worm into each hole. Make sure that the worm dangles clear of the hole. Serve the apples while they are still warm. Add some whipped cream or ice cream, and add an additional gummy worm or 2 in the serving dish.
